description: The Static Analysis Engine subsystem is responsible for performing deep static analysis of the codebase. Its boundaries encompass all components involved in extracting structural information, building call graphs, identifying class hierarchies, determining package dependencies, and storing comprehensive raw analysis results across multiple programming languages. It interacts with external systems primarily through the Static Analysis Orchestrator which acts as its entry point.

components.name: Static Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: This component serves as the central control unit for the entire static analysis pipeline. It is responsible for initiating analysis jobs, managing the lifecycle of language scanners and LSP clients, and aggregating the final results from various language-specific analyses. It acts as the primary entry point for triggering a static analysis operation.

components.name: Language Configuration & Scanner
components.description: This component is tasked with identifying programming languages present in a project, detecting and parsing language-specific project configuration files (e.g., pom.xml for Java, tsconfig.json for TypeScript), and managing the corresponding language-specific configurations and LSP server parameters. It prepares the environment for detailed language analysis.

components.name: LSP Communication Layer (Generic)
components.description: This component provides a standardized, low-level interface for communicating with any Language Server Protocol (LSP) server. It handles the fundamental mechanics of sending requests, receiving notifications, and processing responses, thereby abstracting away the complexities of LSP for higher-level, language-specific clients.

components.name: Language-Specific LSP Client
components.description: These components extend the generic LSP Communication Layer to implement specific logic for interacting with a particular language's LSP server (e.g., Java Development Tools Language Server, TypeScript Language Server). They perform detailed, language-aware tasks such as symbol extraction, definition lookup, and call hierarchy analysis.

components.name: Analysis Data Store
components.description: This component serves as the central repository for all raw static analysis data generated throughout the process. It aggregates and stores Control Flow Graphs (CFG), class hierarchies, code references, and source file information, providing robust mechanisms for data retrieval, persistence, and management.

components.name: Call Graph Builder & Analyzer
components.description: This component is dedicated to constructing and analyzing the call graph of the codebase, mapping the relationships and dependencies between functions and methods. It identifies logical structural components through clustering algorithms and provides critical insights into code execution flow.

components.name: Code Reference Resolver (AI-Enhanced)
components.description: This component provides advanced methods for resolving code references within the codebase. It potentially leverages AI/ML models, specifically Large Language Models (LLMs), to enhance the accuracy and depth of reference resolution, offering more intelligent and context-aware linking of code elements.

components.name: Java Environment Utilities
components.description: This component offers a collection of utility functions specifically designed for managing and interacting with Java development environments. This includes detecting Java installations, locating Java Development Tools Language Server (JDTLS) roots, and constructing JDTLS commands, which are crucial for setting up and operating the Java LSP client.
